You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Update Order Confirmation Email Permissions

Some B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9), CloudCraze 4.8, or CloudCraze 4.7 patches include fixes for compliance with required security alerts. The fixes in these patches help maintain guest user access. But, the fixes also affect managed package code that supports order confirmation emails for registered users and customer service representative (CSR) users.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Salesforce CompatibilitySalesforce not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.


B2B Commerce Compatibility

Any solution upgrading to:

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.36 or later
CloudCraze 4.8 patch 3.133.24 or later
CloudCraze 4.7 patch 3.124.36 or later


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To edit Apex class access settings:	Manage Profiles and Permission Sets
To change workflow rules and actions:	Customize Application
TIP These extra steps are only necessary for:
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.36 or later
CloudCraze 4.8 patch 3.133.24 or later
CloudCraze 4.7 patch 3.124.36 or later

The guest security patches for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) or later don't require these steps.

Enable access for the ccrz.cc_util_Order Apex class on the profile assigned to your registered users.
NOTE This step ensures that your registered users continue to receive order confirmation emails after you install the patch.
From Setup, enter Profiles in the Quick Find box, and then select Profiles.
Click the name of the custom user profile that you assign registered storefront users to.
Scroll to the Enabled Apex Class Access section, and click Edit.
From the Available Apex Classes list, select ccrz.cc_util_Order, and add it to the Enabled Apex Classes list.
Save your changes.
Update the permission set assigned to CSR users. Enable access for the ccrz.cc_util_Order Apex class.
NOTE
This step ensures that order confirmation emails continue to send when CSR users place orders after you install the patch.
For help with modifying the permission set assigned to CSR users, see https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.b2b_commerce_csr.htm.
Deactivate an existing workflow rule that affects order confirmation emails.
TIP If your storefront doesn't allow guest users to check out and create orders, you can skip this step.
From Setup, enter Workflow Rules in the Quick Find box, and then select Workflow Rules.
If you see the Understanding Workflow page, click Continue.
Find the rule named Order Confirmation.
Click Deactivate in the Action column. If the Action column shows Activate, the rule is already deactivated.
SEE ALSO
Remove View All Users Permission from Guest User Profiles for B2B Commerce for Visualforce
